summary: An email from an Assistant United States Attorney in the Southern District of New York to defense counsel for Ghislaine Maxwell, dated October 30, 2021. It transmits a draft verdict sheet and four proposed stipulations of fact for her upcoming trial, requesting a response by November 5, 2021.

events.title: Prosecution Submits Trial Materials
events.description: An Assistant U.S. Attorney emails Maxwell's defense team a draft verdict sheet and four proposed stipulations of fact for her upcoming trial.

events.title: Deadline for Defense Response
events.description: The prosecution requests the defense team respond to the proposed verdict sheet and stipulations by this date.

locations: 1 Saint Andrews Plaza, New York, New York 10007
keyFacts: The document is pre-trial correspondence from the prosecution to Ghislaine Maxwell's defense team in October 2021.
It shows the prosecution was preparing trial materials, including a verdict sheet and stipulations regarding evidence like birth certificates, FedEx records, and school district records.
The email establishes a deadline of November 5, 2021, for the defense to respond to the proposed materials.
The attachments indicate the prosecution intended to introduce specific documentary evidence (GX 1001-1004) at trial.
The correspondence originates from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York, the office prosecuting the case.
